stock.title: STOCK Act
stock.description: Compliance data mandated by federal law since 2012

questions.q: Where does PolitiTrades get its data?
questions.a: All data is sourced directly from official government disclosure filings—the House Financial Disclosure Reports, Senate Periodic Transaction Reports, and SEC EDGAR filings. We verify every transaction against the original documents.

questions.q: How quickly do new trades appear?
questions.a: We monitor official filing systems continuously. New trades typically appear within 15 minutes of publication. Pro subscribers receive real-time push notifications.

questions.q: Is it legal for Congress members to trade stocks?
questions.a: Yes. Members of Congress can legally trade stocks, but must disclose trades within 45 days under the STOCK Act (Stop Trading on Congressional Knowledge Act) of 2012. There's ongoing debate about whether this should change.

questions.q: Should I use this data to make investment decisions?
questions.a: PolitiTrades provides information for research and educational purposes. Congressional trading data is one signal among many. Past performance doesn't guarantee future results. Always do your own research and consider consulting a financial advisor.
Pro includes real-time data, unlimited politician tracking, full historical data back to 2012, performance analytics comparing returns to benchmarks, and API access for building your own tools.
Yes. You can cancel your subscription at any time from your account settings. You'll retain access through the end of your current billing period.

footer.tagline: Track congressional stock trades. See what politicians are buying and selling before the market reacts.
footer.disclaimer: PolitiTrades provides information for educational and research purposes only. This is not investment advice. Stock trading involves risk; past performance does not guarantee future results. Data sourced from official U.S. government disclosure filings.
